text: Merge looks like it was completely done Friday evening and had some unit tests- looks like we have BDD tests that need to be changed and something for the Java framework.
Unit tests were passing.  I know that Greg you were going to do something with the make file- not sure if that did or did not happen.
<@U184J2R7S> note that nothing has been committed to the upstream tree
is that what you meant?
we did the work of resolving the patches, but we havent pushed them yet
<@U0ULK2JPP> picking this back up now
so, I have the work we did on my branch in a fresh environment, but I also updated the make-protos on patch 56
what other changes do I need to pick up?
<@U0KPFAZNF> do you want to hangout so we can talk or just type ?
either is fine
i know we either need to patch chaintool or skip it again
hangout is fine, ill start it up
ok
<https://hangouts.google.com/call/bmap7jyx5jc7tgetgt7uyrl3wee>

text: <@U0ULK2JPP> i am not sure we can go with the original plan of applying your fixes as follow up patches
because the earlier patch(es) wont pass CI if we dont apply them
<@U0KPFAZNF> ok. In the end we need both. do you think we should promote them all for review ?
what I am thinking right now is first I push the base patch, and then I update it it with the fixes as version #2
that way, it can be compiled by CI as one CR, but reviewers can see what was updated
im open to suggestion
<@U0KPFAZNF> sounds good to me. I think giving reviewers a clear view of the process is paramout
